sentences.en: Hal used to sing in the cathedral choir until his voice broke.
sentences.cn: 哈尔在噪音变为成年人的之前一直在大教堂唱诗班唱歌.

sentences.en: He has been singing in his church choir since he was six.
sentences.cn: 他打6岁起一直在教堂唱诗班里唱歌。

sentences.en: He joined a church choir at the age of eight.
sentences.cn: 他八岁时加入了一个教堂唱诗班。

sentences.en: In a window across the street, a boy plays the flute, echoing the choir's songs.
sentences.cn: 在街对面的一扇窗户里，一位少年吹着长笛，附和着唱诗班的歌声。

sentences.en: Robert sings in a church choir.
sentences.cn: 罗伯特在教堂合唱队唱歌.

sentences.en: She sings in the school choir.
She sings in the school choir.
The boy sings bass in the choir.
sentences.cn: 那男孩在合唱团里唱男低音。

sentences.en: The choir chanted in the background.
sentences.cn: 唱诗班在后面唱着赞美诗.

sentences.en: The choir has sung only two verses of the last hymn.
sentences.cn: 合唱团只唱了最后一首赞美诗的两个段落。

sentences.en: The choir is the oldest part of that church.
sentences.cn: 唱诗班的席位是那个教堂最古老的部分.

sentences.en: The choir sang out the two words with great vigour.
sentences.cn: 合唱团把这两个字唱得十分有力.

sentences.en: The choir sang the words out with great vigor.
sentences.cn: 合唱团以极大的热情唱出了歌词.
唱诗班的演唱准确无误。

sentences.en: The choir sings both sacred and secular music.
sentences.cn: 唱诗班既唱圣乐也唱世俗歌曲.

sentences.en: The choir was ( singing ) distinctly out of tune in places.
sentences.cn: 合唱团有些地方明显 ( 唱 ) 走调了.

sentences.en: The church choir is [ are ] singing tonight.
sentences.cn: 今晚教堂 歌唱 队要唱诗.

sentences.en: We visited the church where Schubert sang in the choir.
sentences.cn: 我们访问了舒伯特曾在其唱诗班中歌唱的那个教堂.

sentences.en: You joined the choir, but you don't even like singing. What is your design anyway?
sentences.cn: 你根本不喜欢唱歌，但是你还是加入了唱诗班。到底你想干什么？

trans.tran_cn: （教堂的）唱诗班，唱诗席，（学校的）合唱队
trans.tran_en: a group of people who sing together for other people to listen to
